page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: Housing Blackhead Many old houses have been extended and given electricity and indoor sanitation.House and buildings often form a square for protection. At Treleaver a new farmhouse has been built and the old one converted for holiday cottages.Bungalows and villas have been built for agricultural workers and retired farmers.Four farmhouses have been bought by retired incomers.One retired tennant farmer lives in a caravan on a quarter acre. One family live in an old bus waiting to be rehoused. Chynhalls Farm has an order to remain thatched and is an official maritime mark.The owner wrote to Mrs.Thatcher the Prime Minister to get a grant to maintain it.
